hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout via 20D Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility compresses below 35% while price consolidates within a 5% range for 10 days, a breakout above the consolidation high on >1.5x average volume will signal a transition to a BULL regime with an average forward 5-day return of +8%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes directional breakouts. The combination of volatility compression, tight range, and high-volume breakout provides a high-probability signal of regime transition as institutional capital re-enters.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low)/low < 5% over last 10 days
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20D average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5-day return reaches +8% OR regime transitions to BULL (confidence > 70%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain (close back inside range within 2 days) OR forward 5-day return is negative more than 55% of signals.
